summary: The Channel Islands are a group of islands in the English Channel, near France. They are split into two areas: Jersey and Guernsey. Each area has its own rules and leaders, but the UK helps with their defense and talking to other countries. The islands are not part of the UK or the European Union. They have about 171,916 people living there. The term "Channel Islands" started around 1830 to describe these islands only.
title: Channel Islands
